intro: Bupleurum octoradiatum, commonly known as the eight-rayed bellflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic and medicinal plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, branched stems and clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale blue. Its leaves are pinnately divided, giving it a delicate, fern-like appearance. Bupleurum octoradiatum is often found in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to high-altitude environments.
